page.title: 16THE MILLDAM
page.content: The{Mill}was built in{1883}and was powered by water from the{Milldam}.The dam was worked by a screw which was turned{anticlockwise}to open and {clockwise}to close.The Mill was working from October to May and was the island Mill.The folk came anytime anyday with oats and corn to be milled. The dam was full for working in winter and drained in summer for{peat cutting.It was not good peat which was cut.One man tried to measure how much moss there was and got down more than {20 feet of solid moss. The mill shut down because folk started feeding the oats to the hens. Shapinsay sent eggs all over Scotland. The Mill Wheel is iron and the biggest in Orkney.It is in very good condition.
